name: The Serpent and the Saint
description:
The Pink House is a historical property in Homewood, Alabama. Built in 1921 by eccentric artists Eleanor and George Bridges, the home was a gathering place for influential artists such as Zelda and F. Scott Fitzgerald and Earnest Hemingway. When I visited the property with the current owner I was allowed to observe the energy and see if I felt the presence of spirits. This property feels like there’s always an orchestra, a party that will never ever end. 
This statue was found tossed aside on the property and placed here by the current owner. It shows what appears to be a Saint in ecstasy with a serpent rising behind him. Behind the statue are pink flowers, as the original owners planted countless perennial pink flowers and plants all over the property that still grow today.  I love this unique and strange statue, it calls out for all who see it to comment on its beauty.
